title: Hacking going on.
body:
Guys, most of you should be aware of a hacking incident occurring in OCE. Many people including me, are getting hacked. The hackers are logging into accounts and telling others on their friend list that they are getting free mystery skins.

These mystery skins include Black frost annivia and pool party graves, when i checked my accounts these didnt show up, these are scamms.
If you find any of these scams, please post it here and riot would be able to solve this problem. And please dont press the link in the scamms.

replies.body:
Riot, if you guys are available to see this, please help solve this problem, it has been 28 days since you posted something like this, but yet nothing has taken place the hackers are still going on with our accounts.

Please help solve this problem. {{item:3070}}

People make up new scams every day & while Riot is aware of the problem, it is very difficult to tackle. 

It is up to the users to keep their accounts safe, and [Riot provides plenty of resources and guides to help you do so.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751664-Protecting-Your-Account)

>[Good time to check over on this thread.](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/8GVrAi62-security-reminder-beware-of-scamsphishing-sites)

**Please don't post any links here**, as other players might click on the links (even if they obvious scams)

If you do encounter a scam and your account becomes compromised, please go through and change all your passwords and verify your email [HERE](https://account.leagueoflegends.com/oce/en/protect).

You can read more about keeping your account safe [HERE](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751664-Protecting-Your-Account)

If you're handing out your log-on details (which is how the vast majority of theses kinds of scams work) then it's your own fault. Riot has stated, in more than one way, that you should ***NEVER*** give your log-on details to ***ANYONE***, not even Riot staff.

A good rule of thumb is; if it's not endorsed by Riot, don't use it.
Its not the scams, face it, the majority of people know that they are scams. Its the fact that people r hacking onto our accounts who dont know what our passwords are.
Verifying your account email and regularly changing passwords should make the risk of this type of hacking significantly less.

Yeah ikr got hacked and it sent everyone this thing where it said claim your free skin at bjergsen live stream and when u click on it it takes u to a misleading page with a league of legends page that looks exactly the same as the original.You then login and they take your username and password,login to ur account and send it to all ur friends.Change your password as soon as you login if this has happened to you{{item:3070}}
